benchmark_details.name: RAD-Bench (Retrieval Augmented Dialogue Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: RAD-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate Large Language Models' capabilities in multi-turn dialogues following retrievals, focusing on Retrieval Synthesis and Retrieval Reasoning across various practical scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the retrieval capabilities of large language models in multi-turn dialogue scenarios.

data.source: Curated from real-world dialogue data for multi-turn interaction scenarios.
data.annotation: Manual inspection and scoring through the LLM-as-a-Judge framework.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from evaluating responses based on scenario-specific criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate stronger performance in effectively utilizing retrieved context for dialogue.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison of evaluated models across scenarios using Elo ratings.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against multiple prevalent language models to assess benchmark effectiveness.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for model bias if scenarios are not representative of diverse dialogue contexts.
